title: Llanfairpwllgwyngyll
summary: Llanfairpwllgwyngyll or Llanfair Pwllgwyngyll (pronounced [ɬanˌvair puɬˈɡwɨ̞nɡɨ̞ɬ]) is a large village and local government community on the island of Anglesey, Wales, on the Menai Strait next to the Britannia Bridge and across the strait from Bangor. Both shortened (Llanfairpwll or Llanfair PG) and lengthened (Llanfair­pwllgwyngyll­gogery­chwyrn­drobwll­llan­tysilio­gogo­goch) forms of the placename are used in various contexts (with the longer form pronounced [ˌɬanvair​pʊɬˌɡwɨ̞ŋɡɨ̞ɬ​ɡɔˌɡɛrə​ˌχwərn​ˌdrɔbʊɬ​ˌɬan​təˌsɪljɔ​ˌɡɔɡɔ​ˈɡoːχ] (listen)).
